title: Acute vs. Chronic Stress
content: Acute stress is short-term response to immediate demands. Chronic stress is sustained pressure over time. Acute stress may enhance performance briefly; chronic stress degrades health, judgment, and reliability. Different sources require different management approaches.

mcq.question: An operator has been under sustained work pressure for months with no relief. What concerns does this raise?

options.B: Chronic stress may be degrading their judgment, health, and performance
options.D: Workload is a personal management issue

mcq.explanation: Chronic stress has cumulative effects: impaired decision-making, health problems, increased error rates, reduced resilience. Unlike acute stress, people don't adapt—they deplete. Organizations must manage chronic stress exposure.

openQuestions: What chronic stressors affect your workplace?
How does your organization recognize and address chronic stress?
